description: {"blocks":[{"key":"adqod","text":"The KAPA HyperPlus Kit provides a versatile, streamlined DNA fragmentation and library construction protocol for the rapid preparation of libraries for Illumina sequencing. The one-tube chemistry and protocol improves the efficiency and consistency of library construction, and yields libraries of similar or better quality than those produced with the KAPA HyperPrep Kit from Covaris sheared DNA. It outperforms tagmentation-based workflows in terms of robustness, flexibility and sequence coverage and uniformity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"92b1v","text":"The workflow combines enzymatic steps and employs minimal bead-based cleanups, thereby reducing sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amev9","text":"handling and overall library preparation time to 1.5 – 3 hrs. The kit contains all of the enzymes and reaction buffers required for:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tfn0","text":"1. enzymatic fragmentation to produce dsDNA fragments;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duch9","text":"2. end repair and A-tailing to produce end-repaired,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo55d","text":"5'-phosphorylated, 3'-dA-tailed dsDNA fragments;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"155or","text":"3. adapter ligation, during which dsDNA adapters with 3'-dTMP overhangs are ligated to 3'-dA-tailed molecules; and","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etet4","text":"4. library amplification (optional), which employs highfidelity, low-bias PCR to amplify library fragments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"266qv","text":"carrying appropriate adapter sequences on both ends.
